SENT.plain: The verbal communication skills of six children with craniofacial syndromes were examined
The subjects were four girls with Apert syndrome, a boy with Crouzon disease, and a fifth girl with Saethre-Chotzen Syndrome
They ranged in age from six to sixteen years
Each of the six subjects demonstrated oral structural anomalies and at least a mild communication problem
Sample size precluded the formation of judgments relative to the population as a whole or to particular subgroups
